perturbation.original_text: 1.2  End User  means  any  third  Party  receiving  Content  on  a  mobile           device  for  a  payment in accordance with the terms and conditions of           this  Agreement  for  their  own  private  and  non-  commercial  use.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.2  End User  means  any  individual  receiving  Content  on  a  mobile           device  for  a  payment in accordance with the terms and conditions of           this  Agreement  for  any  type of use.
perturbation.explanation: The original definition specifies "private and non-commercial use," aligning with standard content licensing for personal consumption. The modified definition broadens this to "any type of use," potentially conflicting with copyright laws that distinguish between commercial and non-commercial uses and may subject plan_b to copyright infringement claims for unauthorized commercial use if not explicitly licensed.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Copyright Law (specifically, the distinction between commercial and non-commercial use)

perturbation.original_text: 5.4  LICENSOR  warrants  that  Content  does  not  infringe an intellectual           property  right  enforceable in the agreed country of delivery or use.           LICENSOR indemnifies and holds harmless plan_b against all claims that           Content  infringes any of the above mentioned rights of a third Party.           LICENSOR  shall  pay  all damages awarded in a trial to a third Party.
perturbation.changed_text: 5.4  LICENSOR  believes that  Content  does  not  infringe an intellectual           property  right  enforceable in the agreed country of delivery or use.           LICENSOR may assist, to a reasonable extent, plan_b against claims that           Content infringes any of the above mentioned rights of a third Party.           LICENSOR is responsible only for damages directly attributable to gross negligence.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause provides a clear warranty against intellectual property infringement and full indemnification. The modified clause replaces the 'warrants' with 'believes', weakening the guarantee. Furthermore, limiting liability to 'gross negligence' significantly reduces LICENSOR's responsibility, contradicting standard intellectual property protection obligations and shifting the risk of infringement lawsuits and associated costs to plan_b. This creates uncertainty in enforcing the contract regarding intellectual property rights.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Intellectual Property Law (specifically, warranties and indemnification related to copyright and trademark infringement)

perturbation.original_text: 10.1 This Agreement  shall  be  governed  and  construed in accordance with           the  laws  of  the  United  States of America. The courts of competent           jurisdiction  at  New  York  City,  New York, shall have the exclusive           jurisdiction  over  any  dispute  arising out of or in connection with           this  Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: 10.1 This Agreement  shall  be  interpreted according to principles of fairness. Any disputes will be resolved through mediation in a location chosen by Licensor. If mediation fails, resolution will occur through a method determined by Licensor.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause specifies that US Law governs the contract. The modified version removes that clause and replaces it with 'principles of fairness'. Also, it removes the guarantee of using courts of competent jurisdiction. This is important because the laws in New York have set precedent and would usually protect plan_b's rights. This could introduce bias.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law (specifically, choice of law and forum selection clauses)
